intro: Grossularia burejensis, commonly known as the Burejani pomegranate, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by bright red, round berries resembling pomegranates. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
